page.title: 04SOUNDS AROUND BYFIELD
page.content: THERE IS A MAIN ROAD IN BYFIELD WHICH MEANS THAT YOU CAN HEAR CARS AND LORRIES GOING ALONG IT MAINLY WHEN YOU ARE IN THE MIDDLE OF THE VILLAGE.IT GOES TO BANBURY ONE WAY,GOING THROUGH CHIPPING WARDEN AND WARDINGTON, AND IT GOES TO DAVENTRY THE OTHER WAY,GOING THROUGH CHARWELTON AND BADBY.OVER ONE SIDE OF THE MAIN ROAD YOU CAN HEAR THE CHURCH CLOCK CHIMING THE HOUR,THE QUARTER,THE HALF AND THE THREE QUARTER. IN THE SUMMER YOU CAN HEAR BIRDS EVERY- WHERE IN THE VILLAGE AS THERE ARE MANY TREES ABOUT.MANY AEROPLANES COME OVER BYFIELD,OF WHICH MOST COME FROM UPPER HEYFORD.SOME OF THEM THAT COME OVER ARE VERY LOW AND THEY GO OVER VERY SLOWLY AND LOUDLY.OCCASIONALLY A TRACTOR MAY BE HEARD ON THE OUTSKIRTS OF THE VILLAGE WHEN PLOUGHING,ETC.
